title: Strategies for Improving Mathematics Learning Outcomes Through Online Examinations

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics knowledge (calculus, linear algebra, etc.)
context.additional_context: Learners complete a summative assessment-focused mathematics curriculum in a non-real-time LMS environment using personal devices. Incorporates online exam strategies designed by instructional design experts with over 10 years of experience.

learning_goals: Learners improve mathematical problem-solving abilities by over 20% through frequent online assessments (6 sessions)

In open-book exams, learners can solve at least two out of three calculus problems requiring three or more reasoning steps using textbooks and digital tools (e.g., Wolfram Alpha, GeoGebra) and submit strategy documents explaining step-by-step solution processes for each problem.
By utilizing retake opportunities (2 times), learners achieve a 15% average score increase in final exams through error analysis
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
